oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Threshing crew
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of a threshing crew that traveled from farm to farm in the Curlee Community. Charlie Hubbard "C. H." Gaither (1882-1928), second from right, owned the threshing machine. Fourth from right is his father, Thomas "Tomie" Gaither (1841-1917). The two young boys in front are children of the man behind them, Billy Whorley.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Carts & wagons; Threshing; Threshing machines
